attributes.title: Aerial Imagery
attributes.title-tooltip: Aerial Photos Raster Tiles provided by DoITT GIS

meta.description: NYC DoITT GIS Aerial Photography Tile Layers (TMS)

attributes.title: Pending City Map Alterations
attributes.title-tooltip: Proposed Alterations to the City Map that have been approved in public review but have not yet been officially enacted. These alterations have not yet taken effect and are shown for illustrative purposes.

meta.description: NYC Department of City Planning Technical Review Division

attributes.title: Adopted City Map Alterations
attributes.title-tooltip: An index of alterations to the City Map. Alteration Maps show changes made to the City Map and, when they are the most recent in an area, serve as an official record of the City Map in the area they depict.

meta.description: NYC Department of City Planning Technical Review Division

attributes.title: Appendix J Designated M Districts
attributes.title-tooltip: Designated areas within Manufacturing Districts in which self service storage facilities are subject to certain as-of-right provisions (subarea 1) or are subject to special permit by the City Planning Commission (subarea 2)

meta.description: Appendix J Designated M Districts Shapefile

attributes.title: Arterial Highways & Major Streets
attributes.title-tooltip: Designated rights-of-way shown on the Master Plan of Arterial Highways and Major Streets (not an exact copy).

meta.description: NYC Department of City Planning Technical Review Division
Administrative and Political Districts v17D, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™
Administrative and Political Districts v17D, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Building Footprints
attributes.title-tooltip: Building footprints based on OpenStreetMap data

meta.description: OpenStreetMap Building Footprints via Mapbox Vector Tile Service

attributes.title: Business Improvement Districts
attributes.title-tooltip: A Business Improvement District (BID) is a geographical area where local stakeholders oversee and fund the maintenance, improvement, and promotion of their commercial district.

meta.description: Business Improvement Districts Shapefile on the NYC Open Data Portal
NYC Department of City Planning Technical Review Division

items.label: Mapped Street
items.tooltip: A street that has been established on an adopted alteration map or section map and filed with the appropriate agencies

items.label: Street Treatment
items.tooltip: Lines on the City Map that reflect curb lines, approach ramps and other physical elements for illustrative purposes only - may be changed without public review (ULURP)

items.label: Unmapped Street
items.tooltip: A street that is not officially shown on the City Map and over which the public may or may not have a right of way. Record streets and private roads are examples of unmapped streets.

attributes.title: Coastal Zone Boundary
attributes.title-tooltip: Projects within the coastal zone boundary are subject to additional review under the Waterfront Revitalization Program

meta.description: WRP Coastal Zone Boundary v2016.1, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Commercial Overlays
attributes.title-tooltip: A commercial overlay is a C1 or C2 district mapped within residential districts to serve local retail needs.

meta.description: NYC GIS Zoning Features February 2018, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™
Administrative and Political Districts v17D, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Environmental Designations
attributes.title-tooltip: An E-Designation is a NYC zoning map designation that indicates the presence of an environmental requirement pertaining to potential Hazardous Materials Contamination, Window/Wall Noise Attenuation, or Air Quality impacts on a particular tax lot.

meta.description: (E) Designations release June 2018, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Effective Flood Insurance Rate Maps 2007
attributes.title-tooltip: The Effective Flood Insurance Rate Maps (FIRMs), first adopted by New York City in 1983 and last updated in 2007, establish the floodplain currently subject to the National Flood Insurance Program purchase requirements.

meta.description: Effective Flood Insurance Rate Maps (FIRMs) data are available at FEMA Flood Map Service Center

attributes.title: Preliminary Flood Insurance Rate Maps 2015
attributes.title-tooltip: Released in 2015 as part of a citywide flood map update, the Preliminary FIRMs establish the 1% annual chance floodplain. For building code and zoning purposes, the more expansive of the either the 2015 or 2007 maps is used.

meta.description: Flood Insurance Rate Data provided by FEMA

attributes.title: Effective Flood Insurance Rate Maps 2007
attributes.title-tooltip: The Effective Flood Insurance Rate Maps (FIRMs), first adopted by New York City in 1983 and last updated in 2007, establish the floodplain currently subject to the National Flood Insurance Program purchase requirements.

meta.description: Effective Flood Insurance Rate Maps (FIRMs) data are available at FEMA Flood Map Service Center

attributes.title: FRESH Zones
attributes.title-tooltip: FRESH promotes the establishment and expansion of neighborhood grocery stores in underserved communities by providing zoning and financial incentives

meta.description: FRESH Food Stores Zoning Boundaries release 2016.1, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Greater Transit Zone
attributes.title-tooltip: The rules for Qualifying Residential Sites are modified by a lot’s relationship to the Greater Transit Zone. Being located within the Greater Transit Zone may allow for more or different development opportunities.

meta.description: Greater Transit Zone, December 2024 City of Yes for Housing Opportunity

attributes.title: Transit Zones Parking Geographies
attributes.title-tooltip: Geography defined in ZR#12-10 Definitions under Manhattan Core and ZR#16-02 Definitions and parking requirements defined in ZR#13-041 Applicability of parking regulations within the Manhattan Core and ZR#16-051 Applicability of parking regulations within the Long Island City area

meta.description: Transit Zones Parking, December 2024 City of Yes for Housing Opportunity

attributes.title: Historic Districts
attributes.title-tooltip: Areas designated by the NYC Landmarks Preservation Commission that possess historical significance and to which special zoning regulations apply

meta.description: Historic Districts Shapefile, NYC Open Data Portal

attributes.title: Inclusionary Housing Designated Areas
attributes.title-tooltip: Areas where zoning incentives are offered to encourage the creation of permanently affordable housing

meta.description: Inclusionary Housing Designated Areas release 2017.7, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Industrial Business Zones
attributes.title-tooltip: Industrial Business Zones (IBZs) are areas where expanded business services are available for industrial and manufacturing businesses. This designation fosters high-performing business districts by creating competitive advantages over locating in areas outside of New York City.

meta.description: Business Improvement Districts Shapefile on nycedc.com

attributes.title: Landmarks
attributes.title-tooltip: Sites designated by the NYC Landmarks Preservation Commission that possess historical significance and to which special zoning regulations apply

meta.description: Individual Landmarks Shapefile, NYC Open Data Portal

attributes.title: Limited Height Districts
attributes.title-tooltip: A limited height district may be superimposed on an area designated as an historic district by the Landmarks Preservation Commission. It is mapped in areas of the Upper East Side, Gramercy Park, Brooklyn Heights and Cobble Hill. The maximum building height is 50 feet in a LH-1 district, 60 feet in a LH-1A district, 70 feet in a LH-2 district and 100 feet in a LH-3 district.

meta.description: NYC GIS Zoning Features June 2018, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Lower Density Growth Management Areas
attributes.title-tooltip: Areas where special zoning controls intend to limit growth and better match available infrastructure and services in lower-density areas experiencing rapid development

meta.description: Lower Density Growth Management Area release 2011.1, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Mandatory Inclusionary Housing Areas
attributes.title-tooltip: Areas where developments, enlargements and conversions over a certain size are required to set aside a percentage of floor area for permanently affordable housing

meta.description: Mandatory Inclusionary Housing (MIH) release June 2018, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Local Law Names
attributes.title-tooltip: Local Law name changes to thoroughfares and public places from 2002 to present

meta.description: NYC Department of City Planning Technical Review Division
Neighborhood Tabulation Areas v17D, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™
Administrative and Political Districts v17D, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™
Administrative and Political Districts v17D, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™
Administrative and Political Districts v17D, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

legend.label: NYC Council Districts
legend.tooltip: 2013-2023 NYC Council District boundaries remain in effect until the end of the year. 2024-2033 boundaries are used in the November 7th, 2023 City Council election.

attributes.title: Paper Streets
attributes.title-tooltip: Streets that are officially mapped but are not built and only appear on paper maps

attributes.title: Pierhead & Bulkhead Lines
attributes.title-tooltip: The Pierhead line is the extent to which piers and platforms over water may be built as shown on the City Map.  The Bulkhead line is the extent to which the filling of land is permitted without additional permits.

meta.description: NYC Department of City Planning Technical Review Division

items.label: Water Edge
items.tooltip: When there are no pierhead or bulkhead lines, boundaries are marked by the water's edge

attributes.title: Preliminary Flood Insurance Rate Maps 2015
attributes.title-tooltip: Released in 2015 as part of a citywide flood map update, the Preliminary FIRMs establish the 1% annual chance floodplain. For building code and zoning purposes, the more expansive of the either the 2015 or 2007 maps is used.

meta.description: Flood Insurance Rate Data provided by FEMA

attributes.title: Special Purpose Districts
attributes.title-tooltip: The regulations for special purpose districts are designed to supplement and modify the underlying zoning in order to respond to distinctive neighborhoods with particular issues and goals

meta.description: NYC GIS Zoning Features February 2018, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Special Purpose Subdistricts
attributes.title-tooltip: Areas within Special Purpose Districts where unique rules apply

meta.description: NYC GIS Zoning Features June 2018, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Stair Streets
attributes.title-tooltip: Street segments with steps or stairs to accommodate foot traffic.

attributes.title: Street Names
attributes.title-tooltip: Legal street names as shown on the City Map

meta.description: NYC Department of City Planning Technical Review Division
NYC Subway Lines and Stops - Originally Sourced from NYC DoITT GIS, combined with SI Railway data from Baruch College NYC Mass Transit Spatial Layers | Subway entrances from NYC Open Data

attributes.title: Tax Lots
attributes.title-tooltip: A tax lot is a parcel of land identified with a unique borough, block and lot number for property tax purposes.

meta.description: MapPLUTO™ v18.1, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: 3D Buildings
attributes.title-tooltip: Extruded building height from OpenStreetMap data

meta.description: OpenStreetMap Building Footprints via Mapbox Vector Tile Service

attributes.title: Appendix I
attributes.title-tooltip: Transit-accessible areas where parking is optional for new affordable housing units and special rules apply to existing affordable units

meta.description: Transit Zones release July 2016, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Waterfront Access Plan
attributes.title-tooltip: These areas reflect site specific modification of waterfront public access requirements for waterfront parcels with unique conditions and opportunities

meta.description: Waterfront Access Plan release 2011.1, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Zoning Districts
attributes.title-tooltip: A zoning district is a residential, commercial or manufac­turing area of the city within which zoning regulations govern land use and building bulk.

meta.description: NYC GIS Zoning Features June 2018, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Pending Zoning Map Amendments
attributes.title-tooltip: Changes to the Zoning Map that are currently undergoing public review

meta.description: NYC GIS Zoning Features March 2018, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™

attributes.title: Zoning Map Amendments
attributes.title-tooltip: Changes to the Zoning Map that have been adopted since 2002

meta.description: NYC GIS Zoning Features June 2018, BYTES of the BIG APPLE™
